translation: The king said, 'Yes, that's right.'"

source_sentence: 時即遣使，往波羅殊提王所，具說上言。
translation: He then sent an envoy to King Prasenajit and explained the above.

source_sentence: 彼作是念：「王舍城牢固，唯有水穀飲食盡乃可得，而城內水穀飲食豐多。」
translation: He thought, "The king's castle is so strong that the only thing that can be obtained is water and food, and there's plenty of water and food in the city."

source_sentence: 彼即報使言：「我不為城故來，我國內七年不雨，聞汝國中有水珠，若出此珠時天即降雨，以是故來。」
translation: He then reported to the messenger, "I didn't come here for the sake of the city. It hasn't rained in my country for seven years, but I heard that there's a pearl of water in your country, and when it comes out, the gods will send rain; that's why I came."

source_sentence: 使答言：「大王！
translation: The envoy replied, "Great king!

source_sentence: 初時何不言須珠？
translation: Why didn't you say "pearl of need" at the beginning?

source_sentence: 若言須珠，我即當與。
translation: If you say you need a pearl, I will give it to you.

source_sentence: 王今可去，尋當送珠。」
translation: Now, the king can go, and I'll send the pearl."

source_sentence: 王即還軍向拘睒彌國。
translation: The king then returned to his army and headed for Kauśāmbī.

source_sentence: 彼聞王憂陀延與婇女遊戲聲，即問傍人言：「戲聲是何人？」
translation: When he heard the sound of the king's udumbara playing with his daughters, he asked someone nearby, "Who's that playing?"

source_sentence: 傍臣答言：「大王知不？
translation: The other ministers replied, "Does the king know?

source_sentence: 王憂陀延與諸婇女乘船遊戲於恒水中，是彼戲聲。」
translation: The king Udayana and his women were riding in a boat on the Gaṅgā River, and this was the sound of their play."

source_sentence: 王即勅傍人勿作聲，放象於恒水邊，彼即放第一白象藏守象人。
translation: The king then commanded the people nearby not to make a sound and released the elephant at the edge of the Gaṅgā River, where he then released the first white elephant into the hide of the elephant keeper.

source_sentence: 時王憂陀延大臣出見白象，白王言：「有野象。」
translation: The king then commanded the minister Udayana to come out and see the white elephant and tell the king, "There's a wild elephant!"

source_sentence: 王即勅人言：「勿作聲牽船近岸。」
translation: The king then commanded the man, "Don't make a sound as you pull the boat near the shore."

source_sentence: 彼即近岸。
translation: He then approached the shore.

source_sentence: 王憂陀延善知調象法術，即誦術彈琴往前取象。
translation: Knowing well the art of elephant control, King Udayana recited the technique and played his lute, going forward to retrieve the elephant.

source_sentence: 時守象人即便捉王，王甚恐怖。
translation: The elephant guards then grabbed the king, and the king was terrified.

source_sentence: 彼問王言：「怖耶？」
translation: He asked the king, "Are you afraid?"

source_sentence: 王言：「我怖。」
translation: The king said, "I'm afraid."

source_sentence: 彼言：「王勿怖。
translation: He said, "Don't be afraid, King.

source_sentence: 波羅殊提王喚王。」
translation: King Prasenajit calls to the king."

source_sentence: 王更恐怖念言：「波羅殊提將無殺我并及侍從耶？」
translation: The king then became frightened and thought, "Will Prasenajit kill me and my attendants?"

source_sentence: 即便繫之，衛送往波羅殊提王所。
translation: He tied it up and sent it to King Prasenajit.

source_sentence: 問言：「汝怖耶？」
translation: He asked, "Are you afraid?"

source_sentence: 答言：「怖。」
translation: He replied, "Fear!"

source_sentence: 王言：「勿怖！
translation: The king said, "Don't be afraid!

source_sentence: 汝可教我兒瞿波羅調象術，并教我女彈琴。」
translation: You may teach my son Gopalā the art of elephant tuning and my daughter to play the lute."

source_sentence: 彼將至慰禪國七年中鎖脚。
translation: He was about to leave for the middle of seven years in the country of Aśvaghoṣa.

source_sentence: 時跋難陀釋子，從拘睒彌奢彌跋提夫人所，來至慰禪國憂陀延所，持王憂陀延信往夫人所。
translation: Then the son of Śākyamuni Bhadrapāla came from Kauśāmbī and went to Udayana in the Land of Solace and took King Udayana's letter to her.

source_sentence: 諸比丘白佛，佛言：「比丘不應為白衣作使，若作突吉羅。」
translation: The monks said to the Buddha, "A monk shouldn't be a messenger for a white man if he's a turgid messenger."

source_sentence: 時彼教王兒調象術，教女彈琴。
translation: He then taught the king's son how to tame an elephant and taught his daughter how to play the lute.

source_sentence: 後於異時遂與王女共通。
translation: At some point later, he was in communion with the king's daughter.

source_sentence: 拘波羅王子知之，彼作是念：「若我白王必奪其命。
translation: Knowing this, Prince Kumbhâṇḍa thought, "If I were to call the king, he would take my life.

source_sentence: 彼是我師，教我辛苦。
translation: He's my teacher who taught me hard work.

source_sentence: 此是王女，彼是王，得應爾耳。」
translation: This is the king's daughter, and he is the king; it's possible that he could have done that."

source_sentence: 即覆藏不語人。
translation: He then hid and didn't tell the person.

source_sentence: 後王憂陀延欲逃走，即自嚴疾行牸象。
translation: Later, the king worried that Tāyān might want to escape, so he took care of himself and quickly marched to the elephant.

source_sentence: 拘婆羅知之，便作是念：「彼自嚴疾行象，必欲逃走。
translation: Knowing this, Kovidāra then thought, "That elephant walking at a great speed must want to escape.

source_sentence: 若我白王必奪其命，此是我師，教我辛苦。」
translation: If I were to tell the king that I would take his life, this is my teacher who taught me about hard work."

source_sentence: 遂藏不語人。
translation: He then hid himself and didn't tell anyone.

source_sentence: 彼安王女置象上，於象上飲，失琉璃器，未至地頃，已從慰禪至拘睒彌國。
translation: The king's daughter put her elephant on top of it, drank from it, and lost her beryl vessel.

source_sentence: 王即至奢彌跋提夫人所，語如是言：「我在彼繫時誓言：『當供養八婆羅門一切所須皆令具足。』
translation: The king then went to Lady Śrāmaṇerī and said, "I vowed when I was tied up there, 'I will make offerings to the eight brāhmaṇas and make everything that's necessary complete.'

source_sentence: 今欲與之，便可辦具。」
translation: Now, if I want to give them to you, you'll be able to do so."

source_sentence: 夫人言：「若如是者，諸象馬車金銀七寶王及我身一切，當盡如許所有并與一人，彼亦都受猶無厭足。」
translation: The lady said, "If that's the case, then the elephants, carts, gold, silver, the seven-jewel king, and all that's in my possession will be given to one person, and they'll accept them all without tire."

source_sentence: 王言：「今當云何？」
translation: The king said, "What will happen now?"

source_sentence: 夫人言：「此摩訶迦旃延，是大婆羅門種。
translation: The lady said, "This Mahākātyāyana is a member of the great Brahman family.

source_sentence: 今可請之并更請餘七婆羅門種比丘，以王如許供具與此八人。
translation: Now, we can invite him and the other seven monks of the Brāhmaṇa family to give these eight people the king's permitted offerings.

source_sentence: 彼法不受，若與亦不受。」
translation: They won't accept the offerings, and if they give them to him, they won't accept them either."

source_sentence: 王言：「可爾。」
translation: The king said, "That's fine."

source_sentence: 時王憂陀延即往迦旃延所，頭面禮足却坐一面，時迦旃延種種方便為王說法令得歡喜。
translation: King Udayana then went to Kātyāyana, bowed his head at his feet, and withdrew to sit to one side, where Kātyāyana explained the teaching in various ways for the king and made him rejoice.

source_sentence: 時王聞法歡喜已，白如是言：「願受我明日請食，通已八人。」
translation: After rejoicing at hearing the teaching, the king said to him, "May I accept my invitation for food for tomorrow, which will be passed to eight people?"

source_sentence: 時迦旃延默然受之。
translation: Kātyāyana then quietly accepted it.

source_sentence: 時王見迦旃延默然受請已，從座起頭面禮足歡喜而去。
translation: Seeing that Kātyāyana had quietly accepted the invitation, the king got up from his seat, bowed his head and feet, and rejoiced.

source_sentence: 王還其家辦種種多美飲食，明日清旦往白時至。
translation: The king returned to his house and prepared a variety of delicious foods, going there tomorrow at sunrise and arriving at daybreak.

source_sentence: 時大迦旃延，清旦著衣持鉢，通已八人，往王憂陀延宮敷座而坐。
translation: Kātyāyana then put on his robe and bowl at sunrise and passed eight people over to King Udayana's palace to prepare a seat and sit down.

source_sentence: 王憂陀延手自斟酌種種多美飲食令得飽足，食已捨鉢，取金瓶盛水授之，以象布施。
translation: After he finished eating, he put away his bowl, took a golden vial full of water, and gave it to him as an elephant offering.

source_sentence: 迦旃延言：「止！
translation: Kātyāyana said, "Stop!

source_sentence: 止！
translation: Stop!

source_sentence: 王此便為供養已，我等不應受如是供養。」
translation: After the king has made this offering, we shouldn't accept such an offering."

source_sentence: 復以車馬人兼金銀、琉璃、頗梨、真珠、車璩、馬瑙七寶布施，迦旃延言：「止！
translation: Again, he offered a gift of seven treasures - gold, silver, lapis lazuli, pāri, genuine pearls, a chariot bead, and a cornelian - to the charioteers, and Kātyāyana said, "Stop!

source_sentence: 止！
translation: Stop!

source_sentence: 此便為供養，我等不應受如是供養。」
translation: This is an offering, and we shouldn't accept such an offering."

source_sentence: 時王憂陀延即禮迦旃延足已，更取卑床坐。
translation: King Udayana then paid homage to Kātyāyana's feet and took his seat on a humble bed.

source_sentence: 時迦旃延，種種為王說法，令得歡喜已，從坐起而去，還寺內白諸比丘。
translation: After he had spoken to the king and made him rejoice, Kātyāyana rose from his seat and departed, returning to the monastery, he told the monks.

source_sentence: 諸比丘白佛。
translation: The monks then said to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛爾時以此因緣集比丘僧，為諸比丘說大小持戒揵度：「如來出世，應供、正遍知、明行足、為善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，於一切諸天、世人、沙門、婆羅門、天魔、梵王，眾中而自覺悟證知為人說法。
translation: It was then that the Buddha gathered the monks for this reason and taught the monks the great and small observances of the precepts, "The Tathāgata appeared in the world as a worthy offering, a correct and omniscient one, the perfection of knowledge and conduct, a well gone, an understander of the world, an unsurpassed person, a tamer, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, and a world-honored one, and among all the gods, humans, ascetics, priests, gods, Māra, and Brahmā kings, he himself realized and realized that he was preaching for people.

source_sentence: 初語亦善、中語亦善、下語亦善，文義具足開顯淨行。
translation: His first speech is good, his middle speech is good, and his second speech is good, and his words and meanings are complete in revealing pure conduct.

source_sentence: 若居士居士子聞，若復餘種姓生者，彼聞正法便生信樂。
translation: If a householder or householder's son hears this, or if another family arises, then he'll hear the right teaching and become confident and happy.

source_sentence: 以信樂心而作是念：『我今在居家妻子繫縛，不得純修梵行。
translation: With faith and happiness, they think, 'Now, I'm tied to a wife at home, and I can't purely cultivate the religious practice.

source_sentence: 我今寧可剃除鬚髮、披袈裟，以信捨家入非家道。』
translation: Now, I'd better shave off my hair, put on the monks' robe, and leave home with faith and enter a path that's not home.'

source_sentence: 彼於異時，錢財若多、若少皆悉捨棄，親屬若多、若少皆亦捨離，剃除鬚髮、披袈裟，捨家入非家道。
translation: At another time, they abandoned their wealth and possessions, whether large or small, and abandoned their relatives, whether large or small, shaved off their hair, put on the reddish-brown robes, and left home to enter the path of the renunciant.

source_sentence: 彼與出家人同除捨飾好，與諸比丘同戒，不殺生放捨刀杖，常有慚愧慈念眾生，是為不殺生。
translation: They join their fellow monks in removing ornaments, share the same precepts as the monks, don't kill, release their swords and staves, and always have a sense of shame and compassion for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 捨偷盜，與便取、不與不取，其心清淨無有盜意，是為不偷盜。
translation: He abandons stealing, takes what's given, and doesn't give or take what's not given, and his mind is pure without the intention to steal; this is non-stealing.

source_sentence: 捨婬不淨行，修梵行勤精進，不著欲愛，清淨香潔而住，是為捨婬不淨行。
translation: Abandoning the impure practice of sexual misconduct, cultivating the diligence of the religious practice, not clinging to desires, and abiding in a pure and clean manner is abandoning the impure practice of sexual misconduct.

source_sentence: 捨妄語，如實不欺詐於世，是為不妄語。
translation: Abandoning false speech and not deceiving the world as it really is is not false speech.

source_sentence: 捨兩舌，若聞此語不傳至彼，若聞彼語不傳至此，不相壞亂。
translation: He abandons duplicity, so if he hears something here and doesn't transmit it to there, and if he hears something there and doesn't transmit it to here, they don't mutually disrupt each other.

source_sentence: 若有離別善為和合，和合親愛常令歡喜，出和合言所說知時，是為不兩舌。
translation: If there's a separation that's well combined, a combination that's loved and always made joyful, and knowledge of what's said when it comes out of that combination, this is not duplicity.

source_sentence: 離麁惡言，所言麁獷苦惱他人，令生瞋恚而不喜樂，斷除如是麁惡言，言則柔軟，不生怨害，能作利益，眾人愛樂，樂聞其言，常出如是利益善言，是為不麁惡言。
translation: Secluded from harsh speech that's harsh and distressing to others and causes anger and displeasure, he stops such harsh speech, speaks softly, doesn't become hostile, and is able to do good, cause people to love and enjoy hearing his words, and always speaks well and beneficially, which is not harsh speech.

source_sentence: 離無利益語，知時語、實語、利益語、法語、律語、滅諍語，有緣而說，所言知時，是為離無利益語。
translation: Being free of unbeneficial speech, knowing when words are spoken, true words, beneficial words, words of the Dharma, words of the vinaya, and words that resolve disputes and are spoken with conditions, and knowing when they're spoken, this is called being free of unbeneficial speech.

source_sentence: 不飲酒離放逸處。
translation: He doesn't drink alcohol and leaves the place of dissipation.

source_sentence: 不著華香瓔珞，不歌舞倡伎亦不往觀聽，不高廣床上坐，非時不食。
translation: He doesn't wear flowers or jewelry, doesn't sing, dance, or play music, doesn't go to watch or listen, doesn't sit on a high or wide bed, and doesn't eat at non-regulation times.

source_sentence: 若是一食，不把持金銀七寶，不取妻妾童女，不畜養奴婢、象馬、車乘、鷄狗、猪羊、田宅、園觀、儲積畜養一切諸物，不欺詐輕秤小斗，不合和惡物，不治生販賣，斷他肢節殺害繫閉，斷他錢財役使作業。
translation: If he eats once, he doesn't handle gold, silver, or seven treasures; doesn't take wives, concubines, or children; doesn't keep slaves, maids, elephants, horses, chariots, dogs, chickens, pigs, and sheep; doesn't farm, look, garden, or store up all kinds of goods; doesn't cheat with small scales or unacceptable things; doesn't treat life and sell it; cuts off other limbs, kills, and closes them; and cuts off other people's money and property to make them work.

source_sentence: 言輒虛詐發起諍訟，棄捨他人，斷除如是諸不善事。
translation: They are quick to speak falsely and provoke arguments, abandon others, and stop such unwholesome things.

source_sentence: 行則知時、非時不行，量腹而食、度身而衣，取足而已。
translation: He walks while knowing the right time and doesn't walk at the wrong time, eating according to his belly and measuring his body for clothing, and simply taking what he can get.

source_sentence: 衣鉢自隨，猶若飛鳥羽翮身俱。
translation: He follows his robe and bowl on his own, just like a bird flying with its feathers and body.

source_sentence: 比丘如是所去之處，衣鉢隨身。
translation: Where a monk goes in this way, he carries his robe and bowl with him.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門受他信施，求種種餘積飲食、衣服、香味觸法；離如是無厭足事。
translation: If other ascetics and priests accept faithful gifts from others and seek various other products of food, clothing, and odors and tastes, they'll part with such things without tire.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，聚集種子種殖樹木鬼神村；離如是事。
translation: If other ascetics or priests eat faithful gifts from others, they gather seeds, plant trees, and go to the village of ghosts and spirits; they part with such things.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施。
translation: As other ascetics and priests eat faithful gifts from others.

source_sentence: 但作方便求諸利養，象牙雜寶高廣大床，種種文繡被褥，及與雜色諸皮；離如是利養法。
translation: They simply seek to make provision for the improvement of things like a high, wide bed made of ivory and mixed jewels, a variety of embroidered bedding, and skins of various colors; they part with such improvements.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，但作方便求自嚴身，酥油摩身、香水洗浴，以香塗身香澤梳頭，著好華鬘染眼紺色，種種莊嚴面首，色綖繫臂捉通中杖，執持刀劍并孔雀蓋，以珠為扇以鏡自照。
translation: Like other ascetics and priests who eat and give faithfully to others but only seek to adorn themselves with skillful means, they rub their bodies with ghee, bathe themselves in perfume, rub their bodies with incense and comb their hair with fragrance, wear fine flower garlands that stain their eyes with a violet color, adorn their faces in various ways, bind their arms with colorful banners, grasp a staff with a passageway, carry a sword and peacock canopy, and use a fan made of beads to shine a mirror on themselves.

source_sentence: 著雜色革屣，著純白衣；能離如是莊嚴之事。
translation: Wearing leather sandals of various colors and a pure white robe, he is able to part with such adornment.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，專為嬉戲，棊局、博掩、樗蒱、八道、十道、或復拍石；斷除如是種種嬉戲。
translation: If other ascetics and priests eat other people's faithful gifts, they specialize in games, gambling, simulations, the eightfold path, the tenfold path, or even tapping rocks; they stop such kinds of games.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，但說妨道法，說王事、賊事、鬪戰軍馬事、大臣事、騎乘事、園觀出入事、臥起事、女人事、衣服飲食事、親里事、國土事、思憶世間入大海事；斷除如是一切妨道之業。
translation: If other ascetics or priests eat alms from other faiths, they only teach things that are disruptive to the path, such as the king's business, the thief's business, the warring army and horses, the minister's business, the riding carriage, the park and observation business, the lying down and rising business, the woman's business, the clothing and food business, the relatives' business, the land business, and the contemplation of the world and entering the great ocean; these are all the disruptive activities that are eliminated.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，無數方便但作諛諂美辭，現相毀訾以利求利；捨如是邪命諛諂。
translation: If there are other ascetics and priests who eat the faithful gifts of others, use countless ways to flatter and praise them, and presently disparage them in order to gain profit, they abandon such false and flattering attempts on their lives.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，常共講論諍言，或在園觀，若在浴池，或在講堂：『我知如是法律，汝無所知，汝趣邪道，我向正道，以前言著後。
translation: If other ascetics or priests eat other people's faith and alms, they always discuss and argue with each other, whether in a garden or a bathhouse or a lecture hall, saying, 'I know this kind of law, but you don't, and you're headed down an evil path while I'm headed toward the right path, saying in the past, 'Attach yourself to the latter.'

source_sentence: 後言著前。
translation: The latter says it's attached to the former.

source_sentence: 我能忍汝不能忍，我勝汝，汝但狂言，共汝論議我今得勝，能問便問。』
translation: I can tolerate what you can't, and I'm better than you; you only talk wildly, discussing with you my victory now, and ask questions when you can.'

source_sentence: 除斷如是一切諍事。
translation: He stops all such disputes.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，但作方便求為使命，若為王、王大臣、婆羅門、若居士通信，從此處往彼處，從彼還此，持此信往彼，持彼信來此，自作是教他作是；能遠離如是使命事。
translation: If another ascetic or brāhmaṇa gives alms to another's faith while eating, but only seeks a mission through skillful means, or if he communicates with a king, a minister of a king, a brāhmaṇa, or a householder, goes from here to that place, returns from there to here, carries this faith to that place, carries that faith to that place, comes here, and does so himself and teaches others to do the same, he'll be able to distance himself from such a mission.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，但作種種鬪戲，或弓鬪、或刀鬪、或杖鬪、或鷄鬪、或狗鬪、或鬪猪、或鬪羖羊、或鬪羝羊、或鬪鹿、或鬪象、或鬪馬、或鬪駝、或鬪牛、或犎牛鬪、或水牛鬪、或鬪女人、或鬪男子、或鬪童男童女；斷除如是一切嬉戲鬪事。
translation: If other ascetics and priests eat faithful alms from others but engage in various kinds of fights, whether it's fighting with bows, fighting with swords, fighting with staves, fighting with chickens, fighting with dogs, fighting with pigs, fighting with ewe, fighting with billy goats, fighting with deer, fighting with elephants, fighting with horses, fighting with camels, fighting with cattle, fighting with zebu, fighting with buffaloes, fighting with women, fighting with men, or fighting with boys and girls, they'll stop all such playful fights.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，行妨道法邪命自活，瞻相男女好惡相，種種畜生以求利養；斷除如是種種妨道法。
translation: Suppose there are other ascetics or priests who eat other people's faithful gifts, practice immoral behavior that prevents wrong livelihood, look at the good and bad features of men and women, and various kinds of animals for profit; these are the various ways to prevent such immoral behavior.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，行妨道法邪命自活，召喚鬼神或復驅遣種種厭禱；除斷如是妨道法。
translation: If other ascetics or priests eat alms that are faithful to others, perform actions that are harmful to the path and wrong livelihood, summon ghosts or spirits, or drive out various kinds of loathsome prayers, they stop such harmful practices.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，行妨道法邪命自活，或為人呪病、或誦惡術、或誦好呪、或治背病若為出汗、或行針治病、或治鼻或治下部病；除斷如是邪命妨道法。
translation: If other ascetics or priests eat alms that are based on faith from others and perform life-threatening acts that are harmful to the path, such as reciting spells for illnesses, reciting bad spells, reciting good spells, curing back problems or sweating, applying needles to treat illnesses, curing the nose, or curing lower illnesses, they stop such life-threatening acts that are harmful to the path.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，行妨道法邪命自活，行藥療治人病或吐或下治男治女；除斷如是妨道法。
translation: If other ascetics or priests eat other people's faithful gifts, practice harmful practices that impair the path, and commit wrong livelihoods on their own, practice medicines to treat human illnesses, or treat men and women by vomiting or falling down, and stop such harmful practices.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，行妨道法邪命自活，或呪火、或呪行來令吉利、或誦剎利呪、或誦鳥呪、或誦枝節呪、或誦安置舍宅符呪，若火燒鼠嚙物能為解呪、或誦別死生書、或誦別夢書、或相手相肩、或誦天人問、或誦別鳥獸音聲書；除斷如是妨道法。
translation: If another ascetic or brāhmaṇa takes a diet of faithful alms from others and practices practices what's harmful to the path and wrong for their own lives, he might recite a fire spell, a curse for good luck in traveling, a balsa spell, a bird spell, a branch spell, a shelter spell, a fire spell that burns rats and traps things, a book on specific birth and death, a book on specific dreams, a book on interlocking hands and shoulders, a book on questions from gods and humans, or a book on the sounds of specific birds and animals; he stops such obstructions to the path.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，邪命自活，瞻相天時，或言當雨、或言不雨、或言穀貴、或言穀賤、或言多病、或言少病、或言恐怖、或言安隱、或言地動、或言彗星現、或言月蝕、或言不蝕、或言日蝕、或言不蝕、或言星蝕、或言不蝕、或言月蝕有如是好報有如是惡報，日蝕星蝕亦如是；除斷如是邪命法。
translation: If other ascetics or priests eat alms that are based on faith from others and their wrong livelihood is self-sufficient, then when they look at the gods, they sometimes say it will rain, or they say it won't rain, or they say the grain is high, or they say the grain is low, or they say they're very sick, or they say they're little sick, or they say they're afraid, or they say they're peaceful, or they say the earth moves, or they say a comet appears, or they say the moon eclipses, or they say it doesn't eclipse, or they say the sun eclipses, or they say it doesn't eclipse, or they say the stars eclipse, or they say they don't eclipse, or they say the moon eclipses have such good retribution and such bad retribution, and so do the sun and stars eclipse; these are the ways to stop such wrong livelihood.

source_sentence: 如餘沙門婆羅門食他信施，行妨道法邪命自活，或言此國當勝彼國不如，或言彼國勝此國不如，或此勝彼不如，或言彼勝此不如，瞻如是吉凶好惡；除斷如是妨道法。
translation: If other ascetics and priests eat the faithful gifts of others and practice what's wrong with the path, then they may say that this country will be superior to another country and not as good as that, or that another country will be superior to this country and not as good, or that this country will be superior to another country and not as good, or that another country will be superior to this one and not as good, or that another will be superior to this one and not as good, and they may consider such good and bad fortune; they stop such things that are wrong with the path.

source_sentence: 彼於此事中修集聖戒，內無所著其心安樂，眼雖視色而不取相，不為眼色所劫，眼根堅固寂然而住，無所貪欲而無憂患，不漏諸惡不善法，堅持戒品能善護眼根；耳鼻舌身意亦如是。
translation: When they cultivate the noble precepts in this way, they have no internal attachments and their mind is at ease; although they look at form, they don't grasp its shape; they aren't robbed by eye form; their eye faculty stands firm and still; they have no desire for it and aren't troubled; they don't contaminate bad and unskillful things; they firmly maintain the precepts and are able to skillfully guard the eye faculty; and so it is with the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

source_sentence: 於如是六觸入中善學護持調伏令得止息，猶若平地四交道頭駕象馬車乘，善調御者左執鞚右持鞭。
translation: In these six sense-fields, he trains well to guard and regulate them so that they're calmed, just like the head of an elephant or horse chariot riding on the level ground in a four-road intersection, and he trains well to hold a reins on the left and a whip on the right.

source_sentence: 善學護持、善學調伏、善學止息比丘亦如是，於六觸入中善學護持、善學調伏、善學止息，彼有如是聖戒得聖眼根，食知止足亦不貪味以養其身，而不貢高憍慢取自支身令無苦患，得修淨行，故苦消滅、新苦不生，無有增減，有力無事令身安樂。
translation: So it is with the monk who well trains to guard, well trains to regulate, and well trains to calm the six sense-fields, who thus attains the noble faculty of vision by virtue of the noble precepts, knows that he has enough to eat, doesn't crave taste to nourish his body, doesn't get proud and arrogant, takes ownership of his body so that it's free of suffering, and cultivates pure practices that cause suffering to cease and new suffering not to arise, have nothing to add or subtract, and make his body comfortable with strength and nothing to do.

source_sentence: 猶如男子女人身患瘡，以藥塗之取令瘡差。
translation: It's like a man or woman who has a sore and applies medicine to it to make it go away.

source_sentence: 比丘食以知足，取令身安亦復如是。
translation: It's likewise when a monk takes a satisfying meal and obtains it to make his body comfortable.

source_sentence: 譬如人以膏油膏車，為財物故，欲令轉載有所至到。
translation: It's like a person who anoints a chariot with oil and grease for the sake of possessions, hoping to get something to carry.

source_sentence: 比丘食知止足取令支身亦復如是。
translation: It's likewise when a monk eats with the knowledge that he's stopped eating and takes it to make his body support itself.

source_sentence: 比丘有如是聖戒得聖諸根，於食中能知止足，初夜後夜精進覺悟，若在晝日若行若坐，常爾一心念除諸蓋。
translation: A monk who thus possesses the noble precepts and attains the noble faculties and is able to know restraint while eating, makes effort and awakens during the first and last nights, and always remains single-mindedly mindful of removing hindrances while walking or sitting during the day.

source_sentence: 彼於初夜若行若坐，常爾一心念除諸蓋。
translation: During the first night, if he walks or sits, he's always mindful with one thought to remove the hindrances.

source_sentence: 彼於中夜側右脇累脚而臥，念當時起繫想在明心無錯亂，至於後夜便起思惟，若行若坐常爾一心念除諸蓋。
translation: During the middle of the night, he lies with his right side turned and his feet crossed, mindfully observing that at that time he's bound up in perception and his mind isn't disturbed, and then at the end of the night he arouses reflection, always remaining single-mindedly mindful of removing the hindrances whether he's walking or sitting.

source_sentence: 比丘有如是聖戒逮聖諸根，食知止足。
translation: A monk who thus possesses the noble precepts acquires the noble faculties and knows when he's had enough to eat.

source_sentence: 初夜後夜精進覺悟，常爾一心念無錯亂。
translation: During the first and last nights, he energetically awakens, always keeping his mind unified with mindfulness without misconstrual.

source_sentence: 「云何比丘念無錯亂？
translation: "How is a monk's mindfulness without misconstrual?

source_sentence: 比丘如是觀內身身念處，精進不懈念無錯亂，調伏慳貪世間憂惱；觀外身身念處，精進不懈念無錯亂，調伏慳貪世間憂惱；觀內外身身念處，精進不懈念無錯亂，調伏慳貪世間憂惱。
translation: A monk thus observes the mindfulness of the internal body as body, and he diligently and unremittingly conducts mindfulness without confusion to subdue stinginess and greed for worldly sorrow; observes the mindfulness of the external body as body, and he diligently and unremittingly conducts mindfulness without confusion to subdue stinginess and greed for worldly sorrow; and observes the mindfulness of the internal and external bodies as body, and he diligently and unremittingly conducts mindfulness without confusion to subdue stinginess and greed for worldly sorrow.

source_sentence: 受、心、法亦如是，是為比丘念無錯亂。
translation: *Feelings, mind, and principles are likewise.* This is a monk's mindfulness without misconstrual.

source_sentence: 云何比丘一心？
translation: What is a monk's unified mind?

source_sentence: 若行步入出，左右視瞻屈申俯仰，執持衣鉢、受取飯食，大小便利，睡眠覺悟，若坐若立，若有所說若復寂然，如是一切常爾一心，是為一心。
translation: If someone walks in and out, looks from side to side, bends and surrenders, carries his robe and bowl, takes his meals, is comfortable in small and large ways, is asleep and awake, sits or stands, and speaks or remains silent, all of these things are always the same mind, which is called single-mindedness.

source_sentence: 譬如有人與大眾共行，若在前若在中若在後，常得安樂而無有畏。
translation: It's like a person who walks with a large crowd, whether in front, in the middle, or behind, and always attains well-being and has no fear.

source_sentence: 比丘亦復如是，行步入出乃至默然，常爾一心。
translation: A monk likewise is always single-minded as he walks, enters, exits, and remains silent.

source_sentence: 比丘有如是聖戒，得聖諸根，食知止足，初夜後夜精進覺悟，常爾一心無有錯亂，樂在阿蘭若處樹下住，或樂處山窟、若在露地糞聚邊、若在塚間水岸間，彼乞食還已洗足，安置衣鉢結加趺坐，直身正意繫念在前，斷除慳貪心不與俱，斷除瞋恚無有怨嫉，心住無瞋、清淨無恚常有慈愍，除去睡眠不與共俱，繫想在明念無錯亂，除斷調愧不與共俱，內心寂滅調愧心淨。
translation: A monk who thus possesses the noble precepts and has attained the noble faculties, knows that he has enough food to stop eating, is enlightened by effort during the first and last nights, and is always single-minded and without distortion is happy to live under a tree in an araṇya place or in a cave on a mountain, near a dung heap on an open field, or near a water bank in a tomb.

source_sentence: 除斷於疑，已度於疑，其心一向在於善法。
translation: Having removed doubt and freed himself from doubt, his mind is always focused on the good Dharma.

source_sentence: 譬如有奴大家，與姓安隱脫奴。
translation: It's like a slave and a householder who's at peace with their family and freed from slavery.

source_sentence: 彼自念言：『我先是奴，而今解脫安隱，已得自在，不復從人。』
translation: They think to themselves, 'First I was a slave, but now I'm liberated and at ease, and I've attained freedom; I won't follow anyone again.'

source_sentence: 以是因緣便得歡喜其心安樂。
translation: Because of this cause, they then rejoice, and their mind is at peace.

source_sentence: 又如有人舉他財物而行治生能得利
translation: It's also like a person who lifts another person's possessions and heeds births, which can be profitable.

source_sentence: 息，還本既畢復有餘在，足以養活妻子，彼自念言：『我先舉債以用治生，而得利息。
translation: When he has finished paying back the capital and has enough left over to support his wife, he thinks to himself, 'First, I raised a debt to cure my livelihood and got interest on it.

source_sentence: 既得還本，復有餘在，足養妻子。
translation: Now that I've repaid the capital, I have enough left over to support my wife.

source_sentence: 我今便得自在，不復畏人。』
translation: Now, I've gained freedom and won't be afraid of people anymore.'

source_sentence: 以是因緣便得歡喜其心安樂。
translation: Because of this cause, he then becomes joyous and his mind is at ease.

source_sentence: 如人久病從病得差，食飲消化身有色力，彼作是念：『我先有病而今得差，飲食消化身有色力。』
translation: Like a person who's been sick for a long time and has recovered from that illness, he eats, drinks, and digests his body with the strength of skin, and then he thinks, 'I was sick before and now I've recovered, and I've eaten and digested my body with the strength of skin.'

source_sentence: 以是因緣便得歡喜其心安樂。
translation: Because of this cause, they then rejoice and are at peace with their mind.

source_sentence: 如人久閉牢獄從獄安隱得脫，彼作是念：『我先繫閉，今已得脫，無所復畏。』
translation: Like a person who has long been confined to prison and has been liberated from prison peacefully, they think, 'I was confined, but now that I've been liberated, I have no further fear.'

source_sentence: 以是因緣便得歡喜其心安隱。
translation: Because of this cause, they then rejoice and their mind is made secure.

source_sentence: 如人多持財寶，度大曠野不遭賊劫安隱得過，彼作是念：『我先多持財寶從曠野得過，而今無所復畏。』
translation: Like a person who often carries treasure and travels across a vast wilderness without being robbed and gets away safely, they think, 'I've carried much treasure and gotten away from the wilderness, and now I have no further fear.'

source_sentence: 以是因緣便得歡喜其心安樂。
translation: Because of this cause, he then becomes joyous and has peace of mind.

source_sentence: 比丘有五蓋亦復如是，如奴、負債、久病、在獄、行大曠野，自見未斷諸結，令心染污慧力不明。
translation: A monk who has the five hindrances is likewise like a slave, in debt, chronically ill, in prison, or walking in a great wilderness, and sees for himself that he hasn't cut the bonds that defile his mind and make the power of wisdom unclear.

source_sentence: 彼即捨欲惡不善法，與覺觀俱而受喜樂，得入初禪。
translation: He then abandons desires for bad and unskillful things, and with perception and contemplation, he experiences joy and happiness and attains the first dhyāna.

source_sentence: 彼以喜樂潤漬於身，遍滿盈溢無不遍處，如人巧浴器盛細末藥，以水漬之和合相得，其水潤漬無有不潤而無零落。
translation: He wets his body with joy and happiness, filling it to overflowing with nothing that doesn't reach everywhere, like when a person fills a bathing vessel with fine herbs, wets it with water, and combines it to obtain it, and there's nothing left that isn't wet and moistened by the water, and nothing falls apart.

source_sentence: 比丘得入初禪亦復如是，喜樂遍身無有空處，此是最初現身得樂。
translation: Similarly, when a monk attains the first dhyāna, joy and happiness pervade his body, and there's no empty space; this is the first time he attains happiness in the present body.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 由不放逸精進不懈，念無錯亂樂處寂靜故。
translation: Because they don't wastefully exert themselves and don't relent, their mindfulness isn't distracted, and they enjoy a peaceful place.

source_sentence: 彼捨覺觀便生內信，心在一處，無覺無觀，心定喜樂，入第二禪。
translation: He then gives up perception and contemplation and develops internal faith, keeps his mind in one place, has no perception and no contemplation, and is happy and concentrated in his mind, which enters the second dhyāna.

source_sentence: 彼以心定喜樂潤漬於身，遍滿盈溢無不遍處。
translation: Their body is wet with the joy and happiness of mind concentration, and it fills it to overflowing with nothing that doesn't reach everywhere.

source_sentence: 猶如山頂之泉水自中出，亦不從東西南北及從上來，即此池中清冷水出，潤漬一池遍滿盈溢無有空處。
translation: It's like the spring on top of a mountain that comes from the middle, not from the east or west, nor from the north or south, nor from above, which is the cool, clear water from this pond that wets a pool, filling it to overflowing and leaving no empty space.

source_sentence: 比丘入第二禪亦復如是，心定喜樂遍滿盈溢，此是第二現身得樂。
translation: Similarly, when a monk enters the second dhyāna, his mind is filled to overflowing with joy and happiness, which is the second present-body attainment of happiness.

source_sentence: 彼捨喜心，住護念樂，身受快樂，如聖所說護念快樂，入第三禪。
translation: He gives up his joyous mind, abides in mindfulness of happiness, and experiences happiness in his body, mindfulness of happiness as described by the noble ones, and enters the third dhyāna.

source_sentence: 彼於身無喜，以樂潤漬，遍滿盈溢，無有空處。
translation: Their body, which has no joy, is wet with happiness, and it fills to overflowing with nothing.

source_sentence: 譬如優鉢羅華、拘頭摩、分陀利華，雖生出地而未出水，根莖華葉潤漬水中，無有空處而不潤漬。
translation: It's like the blue lotus, the kuṭumā, and the puṇḍarīka, which emerges from the ground but doesn't produce water, and whose roots, stems, flowers, and leaves wet the water, but there's no empty space that isn't wet.

source_sentence: 比丘入第三禪亦復如是，離喜住樂潤漬於身無不遍處，此是第三禪得現身快樂所遊戲處。
translation: Similarly, when a monk enters the third dhyāna, there's no place in his body that isn't wet and moistened by joy and happiness, which are the pleasurable playgrounds of the third dhyāna that attain the present body.

source_sentence: 彼捨苦樂憂喜，先斷不苦不樂，護念清淨，入第四禪。
translation: He abandons suffering, happiness, sorrow, and joy, stops neither suffering nor happiness, and guards his mind in purity, entering the fourth dhyāna.

source_sentence: 身心清淨具滿盈溢，無不遍處。
translation: Their body and mind are so pure and full that there's nowhere that they don't reach.

source_sentence: 由若男子女人沐浴淨潔，被以新白淨衣，無有不覆之處。
translation: Because a man or woman is clean and washed, there's no place that isn't covered by fresh, white, and pure clothing.

source_sentence: 比丘入第四禪亦復如是，其心清淨遍滿於身，無空缺處。
translation: A monk who enters the fourth dhyāna likewise has his mind purified and filled to overflowing, with no vacant place.

source_sentence: 彼入第四禪，心不掉動，亦不懈怠，不與愛恚相應，住無動地。
translation: When he enters the fourth dhyāna, his mind isn't agitated or lazy, isn't associated with craving or ill-will, and abides in the ground of immovability.

source_sentence: 譬如密屋，內外泥治，堅閉戶嚮，無有風塵，於內然燈，無有人、非人、風鳥、扇動，其燈焰直上無有曲戾，恬定而然。
translation: It's like a dense house that's coated with mud on the inside and outside, has its doors firmly shut, has no dust, and has an internal lantern that's lit by neither people nor humans, wind birds, nor fans, and whose flame goes straight up without twisting or turning, calmly and unobstructedly.

source_sentence: 比丘入第四禪亦復如是，無有掉動，心無懈怠，不與愛恚相應，已住無動地，此是第四禪現身得樂所遊戲處。
translation: A monk who enters the fourth dhyāna likewise, has no agitation, isn't lazy in mind, isn't associated with craving or ill-will, and has stayed in the ground of immovability, which is the fourth dhyāna where he enjoys the present body as a playground.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 由不放逸精進不懈念不錯亂樂處寂靜故。
translation: "It's because he doesn't indulge in effort, doesn't relentlessly think about mindfulness, and doesn't go into a state of tranquility that's disruptive and enjoyable.

source_sentence: 「彼得定心清淨，無有垢穢，柔軟調伏住無動地。
translation: "Peter's mind of concentration is pure and undefiled, and he stands on the ground of nonmovement with suppleness and control.

source_sentence: 自於身中起心，能化作異身，肢節具足諸根無闕。
translation: Rising from within his own body, he can create a different body with complete limbs and no missing faculties.

source_sentence: 時即觀之，此身色四大合成，彼身色化有。
translation: He then observes, "This body's form is a composite of the four elements, and that body's form is created.

source_sentence: 此四大身色異，彼化身四大色異，從此四大身色中起心化作，彼身諸根肢節具足。
translation: These four major body forms are different, and the four major forms of that body's transformation body are different. From these four major body forms, their minds arise to create that body, which is fully endowed with the senses and limbs.

source_sentence: 譬如有人鞘中拔刀，彼作是念：『此是鞘，此是刀，刀異鞘異。』
translation: It's like a person who pulls a sword out of a sheath and thinks, 'This is a sheath, and this is a sword; the sword is different than the sheath.'

source_sentence: 從此鞘中拔刀出。
translation: From this sheath, he pulls out a sword.

source_sentence: 亦如人筐中出蛇，彼作是念：『此是筐，此是蛇，筐異蛇異。』
translation: It's also like a person who pulls a snake out of a basket and thinks, 'This is a basket, and this is a snake, and the basket is different from the snake.'

source_sentence: 從此筐中出蛇。
translation: From this basket, a snake emerges.

source_sentence: 譬如有人從簏出衣，彼作是念：『此是簏，此是衣，簏異衣異。』
translation: It's like a person who pulls a robe out of a basket and thinks, 'This is a basket, and this is a robe; the basket is different from the robe.'

source_sentence: 從簏中出衣。
translation: Out of the basket comes a robe.'

source_sentence: 比丘亦復如是。
translation: So it is with the monk.

source_sentence: 此是比丘初勝法，何以故？
translation: This is the monk's first superior teaching; why is that?

source_sentence: 由不放逸精進不懈，念無錯亂樂寂靜故，彼以定心清淨乃至入不動地。
translation: Because they don't wastefully exert themselves and don't tire, their mind is not distracted, and they enjoy calmness, so they purify their concentration and enter the ground of immovability.

source_sentence: 從己四大色身中起心化作化身，一切諸根肢節具足，彼作是念：『此身是四大合成，彼身從化而有。』
translation: Rising from his four major form bodies, he creates a mind that transforms into a transformation body, complete with all the faculties and limbs, and he thinks, 'This body is a composite of the four major ones, and that body comes from transformation.'

source_sentence: 此四大色身異，彼化四大色身異，此心在此身、依此身、繫此身。
translation: These four major form bodies are different, and the four major form bodies of their transformation are different, but this mind is in this body, relies on this body, and is bound to this body.

source_sentence: 譬如琉璃摩尼珠瑩治甚明清淨無垢，若以青黃赤綖貫之，有眼男子置掌而觀：『此是珠，此是綖，珠異綖異，此珠繫在於綖。』
translation: It's like a beryl maṇi pearl that's brilliant, clear, and spotless, and if it's pierced with a blue, yellow, or red capsule, a man with eyes to see puts his palm up and observes, 'This is a pearl, and this is a capsule; the pearl is different from the capsule, and the capsule is tied to the pearl.'

source_sentence: 比丘亦復如是，從此四大色身，起心化作化身，一切諸根肢節具足，而作是念：『此身是四大合成，彼身從化而有。
translation: Again, a monk thus arises from these four major form bodies and creates a transformation body with all his faculties and limbs intact, and he thinks, 'This body is a composite of the four major forms, and that body comes from transformation.

source_sentence: 此四大色身異，彼化四大色身異。
translation: These four major form bodies are different, and the four major form bodies of their transformation are different.

source_sentence: 此心在此身、依此身、繫此身。』
translation: This mind is in this body, relies on this body, and is bound to this body.'

source_sentence: 此是比丘第二勝法。
translation: This is the monk's second most excellent dharma.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 由不放逸精進不懈念無錯亂樂寂靜故。
translation: Because they don't indulge in effort, they are relentlessly mindful without misconstruing themselves and enjoy quiescence.

source_sentence: 彼以定心清淨，乃至入無動地，一心修習神通智證。
translation: With a mind purified by concentration, he enters the ground of immovability and single-mindedly cultivates the realization of supernormal cognition.

source_sentence: 彼便能作種種變化，以一身為無數身，無數身還為一身。
translation: They can then create various transformations, turning one body into countless bodies and countless bodies back into one body.

source_sentence: 身能飛行石壁皆過，無所觸閡如行虛空，行住空中如鳥飛翔，出沒於地、如水涌波、或烟或焰、若大火積，手能捫摸日月，身至梵天。
translation: Their body can fly past a stone wall, pass over it without touching anything like walking through space, fly like a bird while walking or standing in the air, emerge from or leave the ground like a spring of water, smolder or burn like a great fire, and reach the Brahma heavens with their hands that can honestly feel the sun and moon.

source_sentence: 譬如陶師善調和泥，隨意所造，欲作何器便能成之而有利益。
translation: Like a potter who skillfully mixes clay and makes whatever vessel they desire, they can make it into something beneficial.

source_sentence: 譬如巧匠善能治木，隨意所造自在成之而有利益。
translation: Like a skilled craftsman who's good at working with wood, he creates whatever he wants to make and brings it into being naturally, with benefit.

source_sentence: 譬如治象牙師善能治牙，隨意所作自在成之而有利益。
translation: Like an elephant tusker who's skilled at tusks, whatever he wishes to make will naturally come into being, and there's benefit.

source_sentence: 譬如金師善鍊真金，隨意所作自在成之而有利益。
translation: Like a gold smith who well refines genuine gold, he freely produces benefit from whatever he wishes to do.

source_sentence: 比丘亦復如是，定心清淨至無動地，隨意所作乃至梵天，此是比丘第三勝法。
translation: Similarly, a monk who has a pure, concentrated mind that reaches the ground of no movement and does as he wishes up to the Brahma heavens is the third most excellent thing a monk can do.

source_sentence: 彼以定心清淨乃至入無動地，一心修習證天耳智，彼天耳清淨過出於人耳，聞二種聲：人、非人。
translation: With a concentrated mind that's pure until he enters the ground of immovability and single-mindedly cultivates the knowledge of the divine ear, his divine ear is purified beyond that of a human ear, and he hears two kinds of sounds: human and inhuman.

source_sentence: 譬如於城郭國邑中有講堂廣大高顯，有聰耳人在中，不勞聽力而聞種種音聲。
translation: It's like a large, lofty lecture hall in a city or town, in which a person with discerning ears is present and hears various sounds without exerting himself to hear them.

source_sentence: 比丘亦復如是，以心定故天耳清淨，得聞人、非人種種音聲。
translation: Similarly, a monk whose divine ear is purified by mental equipoise can hear the various sounds of humans and non-humans.

source_sentence: 此是比丘第四勝法。
translation: This is the fourth excellent quality of a monk.

source_sentence: 彼以定心清淨乃至入無動地，一心修習證他心智，彼知外眾生心，有欲、無欲、有垢、無垢、有癡、無癡、廣心、略心、小心、大心、定心、亂心、縛心、脫心、上心、無上心，皆悉知之。
translation: With a mind purified by concentration ... he enters the ground of immovability and single-mindedly cultivates the realization of knowledge of other minds, and he knows all the minds of external sentient beings, whether they have desire, lack desire, are defiled, are undefiled, are deluded, are without delusion, are extensive, are sketchy, are careful, are large, are concentrated, are disturbed, are fettered, are liberated, are superior, or are unsurpassed.

source_sentence: 譬如自喜男子女人以水鏡自照無不得見。
translation: It's like a man or woman who takes delight in a mirror of water and sees for themselves that nothing is invisible.

source_sentence: 比丘亦復如是，以定心清淨故，知外一切眾生心之所念。
translation: A monk likewise knows what's on the minds of all external sentient beings because his concentrated mind is purified.

source_sentence: 此是比丘第五勝法。
translation: This is the fifth superior quality of a monk.

source_sentence: 彼以定心清淨乃至入無動地，一心修習宿命智證，便能憶識宿命無數若干種事，能憶一生、十生、百生、千生、無數百千生，劫燒都盡國土還生，我在彼生名字如是、種如是、姓如是、食如是、壽命如是、在世如是、壽盡如是、受苦樂如是。
translation: With a mind purified by concentration ... he enters the ground of immovability and single-mindedly cultivates the realization of knowledge of past lives, and then he can recall countless different things from past lives, recall one life, ten lives, a hundred lives, a thousand lives, and countless hundreds of thousands of lives, and return to birth in a land that's burned up after an eon, where I was born with a name like this, a seed like this, a family like this, food like this, a life span like this, a life in the world like this, a life span that ends like this, and experiences pain and pleasure like this.

source_sentence: 從彼命終復生於彼，如是展轉來生於此，如是形色相貌無數種種皆悉憶識。
translation: After that life ends, I'm again born there, and I'm reborn here in turn, recollecting countless different kinds of such forms and appearances.

source_sentence: 譬如有人從己村落往至他國，在於彼間若行、若住、若語、若默，從彼國復往餘國，若行、若住、若語、若默，如是展轉復還其國，不勞多力而能憶識所行諸國：『我從此國乃往彼國，在彼國內如是行、如是住、如是語、如是默；從彼國復至彼國，在彼國如是行、如是住、如是語、如是默；如是展轉還至本國。』
translation: It's like a person who goes from their village to another country, walks, stands, speaks, and is silent there, then goes from that country to another country, walks, stands, speaks, and is silent there, and thus returns to that country in turn, being able to recall the countries they've traveled to without much effort: 'I went from this country to another country and walked, stood, spoke, and was silent there; I went from that country to another country and walked, stood, spoke, and was silent there; and thus returned to my original country in turn.'

source_sentence: 比丘亦如是，能以定心清淨乃至無動地，以宿命智證，能憶無數百千劫種種眾事。
translation: Thus, a monk who can purify his mind with concentration up to the ground of immovability and realize it with knowledge of past lives can recall a variety of things for measureless hundreds of thousands of eons.

source_sentence: 此是比丘得第一明。
translation: This is the monk who has attained the first level of insight.

source_sentence: 斷滅無明，明法生、闇已去，明曉法存，此是比丘憶宿命智證明。
translation: To end ignorance, understand that things arise and darkness disappears, and understand that things remain is the proof of a monk's knowledge of recollection of past lives.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 由不放逸精進不懈，心無錯亂樂處寂靜故。
translation: Because they don't wastefully exert themselves and don't tire, their mind isn't disturbed and they enjoy a peaceful state.

source_sentence: 彼以定心清淨乃至無動地，一心修習見眾生死此生彼，智證彼天眼清淨，見眾生死此生彼，形色好醜善惡、諸道尊貴卑賤，隨眾生所造業報因緣皆能知之。
translation: With a mind purified by concentration ... reaching the ground of immovability, he single-mindedly cultivates the view that sentient beings are born here and here, and with knowledge and realization of the purity of his divine eye, he can see that sentient beings are born here and here, and that their appearance is good and ugly, good and bad, and the nobility and lowliness of their paths are all known according to the causes and conditions of the karmic retribution created by sentient beings.

source_sentence: 如此人造身惡行、口惡行、心惡行，誹謗賢聖、邪見。
translation: Such people commit bad physical acts, bad verbal acts, and bad mental acts, denigrate good and noble people, and hold wrong views.

source_sentence: 以邪見報故，墮地獄、餓鬼、畜生。
translation: As a result of the retribution of wrong views, they'll fall into hell, hungry ghosts, and the animal kingdom.

source_sentence: 如此眾生，身行善、口行善、心念善，不誹謗賢聖、正見、修習正業，身死得生天上人中。
translation: Such a sentient being who conducts himself in a good way, speaks well, and is mindful of goodness, doesn't denigrate the good and noble, cultivates right views, and cultivates right actions will be born among gods and humans when he dies.

source_sentence: 如是天眼清淨，見眾生死此生彼，隨眾生所造業因，皆悉知之。
translation: Thus, the divine eye is purified, sees sentient beings dying and being born here and there, and it fully knows the causes of the actions created by sentient beings.

source_sentence: 譬如廣大平地四交道頭有高顯大堂，有明眼人在中，見眾生從東方來至西方，從西方往東方，從南方往北方，從北方往南方。
translation: It's like a lofty, prominent hall at the head of a vast, level ground with four intersections, in which a man with clear eyes sees sentient beings coming from the east to the west, going from the west to the east, from the south to the north, and from the north to the south.

source_sentence: 比丘如是，以定心清淨乃至無動地，見眾生死此生彼，智證以天眼清淨，見眾生死此生彼，乃至隨眾生所造業報因緣，皆悉知之。
translation: Thus, with a concentrated mind purified to the ground of immovability, the monk sees that sentient beings die here and are born there, and with the wisdom realized through the purified eye of heaven, he sees that sentient beings die here and are born there, and he fully knows the causes and conditions of the results of the actions created by sentient beings.

source_sentence: 此是比丘得第二明。
translation: This is the second level of insight attained by the monk.

source_sentence: 斷無明，明法生、闇已去，明曉法存，此是見眾生死此生彼智證明。
translation: To end ignorance, to see that things arise and darkness depart, and to understand that things remain is the intellectual proof that sees that sentient beings die and are born here and there.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 由不放逸精進不懈，心不錯亂樂寂靜故。
translation: Because they don't indulge in careless effort and don't relent, their mind isn't distracted and enjoys tranquility.

source_sentence: 彼以定心清淨，乃至無動地，一心修習無漏智證。
translation: With a mind purified by concentration ... reaching the ground of immovability, he single-mindedly cultivates the realization of uncontaminated cognition.

source_sentence: 彼如實知苦聖諦集盡道諦，如實知有漏、漏集、漏盡、如實知趣漏盡道聖諦。
translation: They truly know the noble truth of suffering, the truth of the path to the end of contamination, and they truly know the noble truths of contamination, contaminated collection, and contamination's end, and they truly know the path to the end of contamination.

source_sentence: 彼如是知、如是見，從欲漏、有漏、無明漏心得解脫。
translation: Knowing and seeing thus, they attain liberation from the contaminants of desire, existence, and ignorance.

source_sentence: 已得解脫智，我生已盡，梵行已立，所作已辦，更不復生。
translation: Once they've attained the knowledge of liberation, their self-bornness has ended, the religious practice has been established, and the task has been accomplished, and there's no more birth.

source_sentence: 譬如清水中，有木石魚鼈水性之屬，東西遊行。
translation: It's like when there's wood, rocks, fish, and water animals in clear water that travel east and west.

source_sentence: 有眼者觀之，見木石魚鼈：『此是木石，此是魚鼈東西遊行。』
translation: A man with eyes to see it sees wood, rocks, fish, and turtle: 'This is wood and rocks, and this is fish and turtle prowling east and west.'

source_sentence: 比丘亦復如是，以定心清淨至無動地，得無漏智證，乃至不復更生。
translation: In a similar way, that monk purifies his mind with meditation to the ground of immovability and attains the realization of uncontaminated knowledge, so much so that he's no longer reborn.

source_sentence: 此是比丘得第三明。
translation: This is the third insight attained by the monk.

source_sentence: 斷無明，明法生、闇法去，明曉法存，是為無漏智明。
translation: This is untainted cognitive insight that ends ignorance, produces things that are clear, removes things that are dark, and preserves things that are clear and bright.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 由不放逸精進不懈，念無錯亂樂處寂靜故。」
translation: Because he doesn't wastefully exert himself and doesn't tire, his mindfulness is not distracted, and he enjoys the stillness of his place."

source_sentence: (雜揵度具足竟)
translation: (Having fully completed the meditation on the mixed gandharva)

source_sentence: 四分律卷第五十三
translation: Four Part Vinaya, Vol. 53
